about_the_game:
Who will you be? A tyrant who raises taxes and abuses his power, or a great leader who raises a mighty army and builds a grand library? The choice is all yours.

Key Features

  • Choice Based Gameplay
  • Resource Management
  • Character Customization
  • Easily Modable

Take control of a lord and manage your city in this city running simulator. Make sure to balance your resources and navigate the demands of the different factions within the city. Unlock new characters who will come and join your city to help maintain order. Earn new cosmetics to customize the look of your lord. But beware the dangers that plague your little city at night, as you have to choose how to deal with treacherous night events that hurt your factions and drain your resources.

As you sit in your throne room, citizens of the city will come to you with requests, which you can respond to with a variety of responses. Your choices will be reflected in your faction strengths and your resources raising or lowering. If any of these values drops below 0 you lose a life. If you lose all 3 lives, your city is destroyed.

Originally developed on Dreams by Media Molecule, our game brings the creative spirit of its origins to PC. Inspired by the intuitive creation tools of Dreams, we've implemented an easy-to-use modding system, allowing players to create and share their own content.

This game was created by:
Lucas Schubert & Justin Ernst

content_descriptors.notes: The game being text based does not actually show any graphic violent visuals. Although battles, executions, raids, and other violent events that would happen in a medieval city are described. Criminal activity is often described as a threat to your city that you need to deal with as the lord. There are no overtly sexual events in the game, besides some sexual innuendo. There are no instances of profanity in the game, besides one instance where the swear word is censored both in the voice-over and in the written text. In this instance, it isn't even clear what the censored word is meant to be.
